docs.title: Enum: PlantSexEnum
docs.text:
Plant reproductive and sexual system types

URI: valuesets:PlantSexEnum

docs.title: Permissible Values
docs.text: Value Meaning Description ANDRODIOECIOUS None Having male and hermaphrodite flowers on separate plants ANDROECIOUS None Having only male flowers ANDROGYNOMONOECIOUS None Having male, female, and hermaphrodite flowers on the same plant ANDROGYNOUS None Having both male and female reproductive organs in the same flower ANDROMONOECIOUS None Having male and hermaphrodite flowers on the same plant BISEXUAL None Having both male and female reproductive organs DICHOGAMOUS None Male and female organs mature at different times DICLINOUS None Having male and female reproductive organs in separate flowers DIOECIOUS GSSO:011872 Having male and female flowers on separate plants GYNODIOECIOUS None Having female and hermaphrodite flowers on separate plants GYNOECIOUS None Having only female flowers GYNOMONOECIOUS None Having female and hermaphrodite flowers on the same plant HERMAPHRODITIC UBERON:0007197 Having both male and female reproductive organs IMPERFECT None Flower lacking either male or female reproductive organs MONOCLINOUS None Having both male and female reproductive organs in the same flower MONOECIOUS GSSO:011868 Having male and female flowers on the same plant PERFECT None Flower having both male and female reproductive organs POLYGAMODIOECIOUS None Having male, female, and hermaphrodite flowers on separate plants POLYGAMOMONOECIOUS None Having male, female, and hermaphrodite flowers on the same plant POLYGAMOUS None Having male, female, and hermaphrodite flowers PROTANDROUS None Male organs mature before female organs PROTOGYNOUS None Female organs mature before male organs SUBANDROECIOUS None Mostly male flowers with occasional hermaphrodite flowers SUBDIOECIOUS None Mostly dioecious with occasional hermaphrodite flowers SUBGYNOECIOUS None Mostly female flowers with occasional hermaphrodite flowers SYNOECIOUS None Having male and female organs fused together TRIMONOECIOUS None Having male, female, and hermaphrodite flowers on the same plant TRIOECIOUS None Having male, female, and hermaphrodite flowers on separate plants UNISEXUAL None Having only one sex of reproductive organs

    title: Imperfect
  MONOCLINOUS:
    text: MONOCLINOUS
    description: Having both male and female reproductive organs in the same flower
    title: Monoclinous
  MONOECIOUS:
    text: MONOECIOUS
    description: Having male and female flowers on the same plant
    meaning: GSSO:011868
    title: Monoecious
  PERFECT:
    text: PERFECT
    description: Flower having both male and female reproductive organs
    title: Perfect
  POLYGAMODIOECIOUS:
    text: POLYGAMODIOECIOUS
    description: Having male, female, and hermaphrodite flowers on separate plants
    title: Polygamodioecious
  POLYGAMOMONOECIOUS:
    text: POLYGAMOMONOECIOUS
    description: Having male, female, and hermaphrodite flowers on the same plant
    title: Polygamomonoecious
  POLYGAMOUS:
    text: POLYGAMOUS
    description: Having male, female, and hermaphrodite flowers
    title: Polygamous
  PROTANDROUS:
    text: PROTANDROUS
    description: Male organs mature before female organs
    title: Protandrous
  PROTOGYNOUS:
    text: PROTOGYNOUS
    description: Female organs mature before male organs
    title: Protogynous
  SUBANDROECIOUS:
    text: SUBANDROECIOUS
    description: Mostly male flowers with occasional hermaphrodite flowers
    title: Subandroecious
  SUBDIOECIOUS:
    text: SUBDIOECIOUS
    description: Mostly dioecious with occasional hermaphrodite flowers
    title: Subdioecious
  SUBGYNOECIOUS:
    text: SUBGYNOECIOUS
    description: Mostly female flowers with occasional hermaphrodite flowers
    title: Subgynoecious
  SYNOECIOUS:
    text: SYNOECIOUS
    description: Having male and female organs fused together
    title: Synoecious
  TRIMONOECIOUS:
    text: TRIMONOECIOUS
    description: Having male, female, and hermaphrodite flowers on the same plant
    title: Trimonoecious
  TRIOECIOUS:
    text: TRIOECIOUS
    description: Having male, female, and hermaphrodite flowers on separate plants
    title: Trioecious
  UNISEXUAL:
    text: UNISEXUAL
    description: Having only one sex of reproductive organs
    title: Unisexual

docs.title: Enum: ProteinEvidenceForExistence
docs.text:
The evidence for the existence of a biological entity. See https://www.uniprot.org/help/protein_existence and https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genbank/evidence/.

URI: valuesets:ProteinEvidenceForExistence

docs.title: Permissible Values
docs.text: Value Meaning Description EXPERIMENTAL_EVIDENCE_AT_PROTEIN_LEVEL None Indicates that there is clear experimental evidence for the existence of the ... EXPERIMENTAL_EVIDENCE_AT_TRANSCRIPT_LEVEL None Indicates that the existence of a protein has not been strictly proven but th... PROTEIN_INFERRED_BY_HOMOLOGY None Indicates that the existence of a protein is probable because clear orthologs... PROTEIN_PREDICTED None Used for entries without evidence at protein, transcript, or homology levels PROTEIN_UNCERTAIN None Indicates that the existence of the protein is unsure

docs.title: Slots
docs.text: Name Description protein_evidence_for_existence The evidence for the existence of a biological entity

docs.title: Schema Source
docs.text: • from schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets

docs.title: LinkML Source
docs.text:
name: ProteinEvidenceForExistence
description: The evidence for the existence of a biological entity. See https://www.uniprot.org/help/protein_existence
  and https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genbank/evidence/.
from_schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets
rank: 1000
permissible_values:
  EXPERIMENTAL_EVIDENCE_AT_PROTEIN_LEVEL:
    text: EXPERIMENTAL_EVIDENCE_AT_PROTEIN_LEVEL
    description: Indicates that there is clear experimental evidence for the existence
      of the protein. The criteria include partial or complete Edman sequencing, clear
      identification by mass spectrometry, X-ray or NMR structure, good quality protein-protein
      interaction or detection of the protein by antibodies.
  EXPERIMENTAL_EVIDENCE_AT_TRANSCRIPT_LEVEL:
    text: EXPERIMENTAL_EVIDENCE_AT_TRANSCRIPT_LEVEL
    description: Indicates that the existence of a protein has not been strictly proven
      but that expression data (such as existence of cDNA(s), RT-PCR or Northern blots)
      indicate the existence of a transcript.
  PROTEIN_INFERRED_BY_HOMOLOGY:
    text: PROTEIN_INFERRED_BY_HOMOLOGY
    description: Indicates that the existence of a protein is probable because clear
      orthologs exist in closely related species.
  PROTEIN_PREDICTED:
    text: PROTEIN_PREDICTED
    description: Used for entries without evidence at protein, transcript, or homology
      levels.
  PROTEIN_UNCERTAIN:
    text: PROTEIN_UNCERTAIN
    description: Indicates that the existence of the protein is unsure.

docs.title: Enum: ReactionDirectionality

docs.title: Permissible Values
docs.text: Value Meaning Description LEFT_TO_RIGHT None Reaction proceeds from left to right (forward direction) RIGHT_TO_LEFT None Reaction proceeds from right to left (reverse direction) BIDIRECTIONAL None Reaction can proceed in both directions AGNOSTIC None Direction is unknown or not specified IRREVERSIBLE_LEFT_TO_RIGHT None Reaction proceeds only from left to right and cannot be reversed IRREVERSIBLE_RIGHT_TO_LEFT None Reaction proceeds only from right to left and cannot be reversed

name: ReactionDirectionality
description: The directionality of a chemical reaction or process
title: Reaction Directionality
from_schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets
rank: 1000
permissible_values:
  LEFT_TO_RIGHT:
    text: LEFT_TO_RIGHT
    description: Reaction proceeds from left to right (forward direction)
    aliases:
    - LR
    - forward
    - -->
  RIGHT_TO_LEFT:
    text: RIGHT_TO_LEFT
    description: Reaction proceeds from right to left (reverse direction)
    aliases:

    - reverse
    - backward

docs.title: Enum: ReactionRateOrderEnum
docs.text:
Reaction rate orders

URI: valuesets:ReactionRateOrderEnum

docs.title: Permissible Values
docs.text: Value Meaning Description ZERO_ORDER None Rate independent of concentration FIRST_ORDER None Rate proportional to concentration SECOND_ORDER None Rate proportional to concentration squared PSEUDO_FIRST_ORDER None Apparent first order (excess reagent) FRACTIONAL_ORDER None Non-integer order MIXED_ORDER None Different orders for different reactants

docs.title: Slots
docs.text: Name Description reaction_rate_order Reaction rate orders

docs.title: Schema Source
docs.text: • from schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets

docs.title: LinkML Source
docs.text:
name: ReactionRateOrderEnum
description: Reaction rate orders
from_schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets
rank: 1000
permissible_values:
  ZERO_ORDER:
    text: ZERO_ORDER
    description: Rate independent of concentration
    annotations:
      rate_law:
        tag: rate_law
        value: rate = k
      integrated:
        tag: integrated
        value: '[A] = [A]₀ - kt'
  FIRST_ORDER:
    text: FIRST_ORDER
    description: Rate proportional to concentration
    annotations:
      rate_law:
        tag: rate_law
        value: rate = k[A]
      integrated:
        tag: integrated
        value: ln[A] = ln[A]₀ - kt
  SECOND_ORDER:
    text: SECOND_ORDER
    description: Rate proportional to concentration squared
    annotations:
      rate_law:
        tag: rate_law
        value: rate = k[A]²
      integrated:
        tag: integrated
        value: 1/[A] = 1/[A]₀ + kt
  PSEUDO_FIRST_ORDER:
    text: PSEUDO_FIRST_ORDER
    description: Apparent first order (excess reagent)
    annotations:
      condition:
        tag: condition
        value: one reagent in large excess
  FRACTIONAL_ORDER:
    text: FRACTIONAL_ORDER
    description: Non-integer order
    annotations:
      indicates:
        tag: indicates
        value: complex mechanism
  MIXED_ORDER:
    text: MIXED_ORDER
    description: Different orders for different reactants
    annotations:
      example:
        tag: example
        value: rate = k[A][B]²

docs.title: Enum: ReactionTypeEnum
docs.text:
Types of chemical reactions

URI: valuesets:ReactionTypeEnum

docs.title: Permissible Values
docs.text: Value Meaning Description SYNTHESIS None Combination reaction (A + B → AB) DECOMPOSITION None Breakdown reaction (AB → A + B) SINGLE_DISPLACEMENT None Single replacement reaction (A + BC → AC + B) DOUBLE_DISPLACEMENT None Double replacement reaction (AB + CD → AD + CB) COMBUSTION None Reaction with oxygen producing heat and light SUBSTITUTION MOP:0000790 Replacement of one group by another ELIMINATION MOP:0000656 Removal of atoms/groups forming double bond ADDITION MOP:0000642 Addition to multiple bond REARRANGEMENT None Reorganization of molecular structure OXIDATION None Loss of electrons or increase in oxidation state REDUCTION None Gain of electrons or decrease in oxidation state DIELS_ALDER RXNO:0000006 [4+2] cycloaddition reaction FRIEDEL_CRAFTS RXNO:0000369 Electrophilic aromatic substitution GRIGNARD RXNO:0000014 Organometallic addition reaction WITTIG RXNO:0000015 Alkene formation from phosphonium ylide ALDOL RXNO:0000017 Condensation forming β-hydroxy carbonyl MICHAEL_ADDITION RXNO:0000009 1,4-addition to α,β-unsaturated carbonyl

        value: RMgX

    annotations:

        tag: product
        value: alkene
    title: Wittig reaction
  ALDOL:

    annotations:
      mechanism:
        tag: mechanism
        value: enolate addition
    title: aldol condensation

      type:
        tag: type

INFERRED None The RefSeq record has been predicted by genome sequence analysis, but it is n... PREDICTED None The RefSeq record has not yet been subject to individual review, and some asp... PROVISIONAL None The RefSeq record has not yet been subject to individual review REVIEWED None The RefSeq record has been reviewed by NCBI staff or by a collaborator VALIDATED None The RefSeq record has undergone an initial review to provide the preferred se... WGS None The RefSeq record is provided to represent a collection of whole genome shotg...

docs.title: LinkML Source
docs.text:
name: RefSeqStatusType
description: RefSeq status codes, taken from https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genbank/evidence/.
from_schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets
rank: 1000
permissible_values:
  MODEL:
    text: MODEL
    description: The RefSeq record is provided by the NCBI Genome Annotation pipeline
      and is not subject to individual review or revision between annotation runs.
  INFERRED:
    text: INFERRED
    description: The RefSeq record has been predicted by genome sequence analysis,
      but it is not yet supported by experimental evidence. The record may be partially
      supported by homology data.
  PREDICTED:
    text: PREDICTED
    description: The RefSeq record has not yet been subject to individual review,
      and some aspect of the RefSeq record is predicted.
  PROVISIONAL:
    text: PROVISIONAL
    description: The RefSeq record has not yet been subject to individual review.
      The initial sequence-to-gene association has been established by outside collaborators
      or NCBI staff.
  REVIEWED:
    text: REVIEWED
    description: The RefSeq record has been reviewed by NCBI staff or by a collaborator.
      The NCBI review process includes assessing available sequence data and the literature.
      Some RefSeq records may incorporate expanded sequence and annotation information.
  VALIDATED:
    text: VALIDATED
    description: The RefSeq record has undergone an initial review to provide the
      preferred sequence standard. The record has not yet been subject to final review
      at which time additional functional information may be provided.
  WGS:
    text: WGS
    description: The RefSeq record is provided to represent a collection of whole
      genome shotgun sequences. These records are not subject to individual review
      or revisions between genome updates.

docs.text:
name: SequenceFileFormat
description: Standard file formats used for storing sequence data
title: Sequence File Formats
from_schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets
rank: 1000
permissible_values:
  FASTA:
    text: FASTA
    description: FASTA sequence format
    annotations:
      extensions:
        tag: extensions
        value: .fa, .fasta, .fna, .ffn, .faa, .frn
      content:
        tag: content
        value: sequences only
  FASTQ:
    text: FASTQ
    description: FASTQ sequence with quality format
    annotations:
      extensions:
        tag: extensions
        value: .fq, .fastq
      content:
        tag: content
        value: sequences and quality scores
  SAM:
    text: SAM
    description: Sequence Alignment Map format
    annotations:
      extensions:
        tag: extensions
        value: .sam
      content:
        tag: content
        value: aligned sequences (text)
  BAM:
    text: BAM
    description: Binary Alignment Map format
    annotations:
      extensions:
        tag: extensions
        value: .bam
      content:
        tag: content
        value: aligned sequences (binary)
  CRAM:
    text: CRAM
    description: Compressed Reference-oriented Alignment Map
    annotations:
      extensions:
        tag: extensions
        value: .cram
      content:
        tag: content
        value: compressed aligned sequences
  VCF:
    text: VCF
    description: Variant Call Format
    annotations:
      extensions:
        tag: extensions
        value: .vcf
      content:
        tag: content
        value: genetic variants
  BCF:
    text: BCF
    description: Binary Variant Call Format
    annotations:
      extensions:
        tag: extensions
        value: .bcf
      content:
        tag: content
        value: genetic variants (binary)
  GFF3:
    text: GFF3
    description: Generic Feature Format version 3
    annotations:
      extensions:
        tag: extensions
        value: .gff, .gff3
      content:
        tag: content
        value: genomic annotations
  GTF:
    text: GTF
    description: Gene Transfer Format
    annotations:
      extensions:
        tag: extensions
        value: .gtf
      content:
        tag: content
        value: gene annotations
  BED:
    text: BED
    description: Browser Extensible Data format
    annotations:
      extensions:
        tag: extensions
        value: .bed
      content:
        tag: content
        value: genomic intervals
  BIGWIG:
    text: BIGWIG
    description: BigWig format for continuous data
    annotations:
      extensions:
        tag: extensions
        value: .bw, .bigwig
      content:
        tag: content
        value: continuous genomic data
  BIGBED:
    text: BIGBED
    description: BigBed format for interval data
    annotations:
      extensions:
        tag: extensions
        value: .bb, .bigbed
      content:
        tag: content
        value: genomic intervals (indexed)
  HDF5:
    text: HDF5
    description: Hierarchical Data Format 5
    annotations:
      extensions:
        tag: extensions
        value: .h5, .hdf5
      content:
        tag: content
        value: multi-dimensional arrays
  SFF:
    text: SFF
    description: Standard Flowgram Format (454)
    annotations:
      extensions:
        tag: extensions
        value: .sff
      content:
        tag: content
        value: 454 sequencing data
      status:
        tag: status
        value: legacy
  FAST5:
    text: FAST5
    description: Fast5 format (Oxford Nanopore)
    annotations:
      extensions:
        tag: extensions
        value: .fast5
      content:
        tag: content
        value: nanopore raw signal data
  POD5:
    text: POD5
    description: POD5 format (Oxford Nanopore, newer)
    annotations:
      extensions:
        tag: extensions
        value: .pod5
      content:
        tag: content
        value: nanopore raw signal data (compressed)

Different platforms and software versions use different ASCII offsets.

docs.title: Permissible Values
docs.text: Value Meaning Description SANGER None Sanger/Phred+33 (PHRED scores, ASCII offset 33) SOLEXA None Solexa+64 (Solexa scores, ASCII offset 64) ILLUMINA_1_3 None Illumina 1 ILLUMINA_1_5 None Illumina 1 ILLUMINA_1_8 None Illumina 1

docs.text: Name Description sequence_quality_encoding Quality score encoding standards used in FASTQ files and sequencing data

docs.title: Schema Source
docs.text: • from schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets

docs.title: LinkML Source
docs.text:
name: SequenceQualityEncoding
description: 'Quality score encoding standards used in FASTQ files and sequencing
  data.

  Different platforms and software versions use different ASCII offsets.'
title: Sequence Quality Score Encodings
from_schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets
rank: 1000
permissible_values:
  SANGER:
    text: SANGER
    description: Sanger/Phred+33 (PHRED scores, ASCII offset 33)
    annotations:
      ascii_offset:
        tag: ascii_offset
        value: 33
      score_range:
        tag: score_range
        value: 0-93
      platforms:
        tag: platforms
        value: NCBI SRA, Illumina 1.8+
  SOLEXA:
    text: SOLEXA
    description: Solexa+64 (Solexa scores, ASCII offset 64)
    annotations:
      ascii_offset:
        tag: ascii_offset
        value: 64
      score_range:
        tag: score_range
        value: -5-62
      platforms:
        tag: platforms
        value: Early Solexa/Illumina
  ILLUMINA_1_3:
    text: ILLUMINA_1_3
    description: Illumina 1.3+ (PHRED+64, ASCII offset 64)
    annotations:
      ascii_offset:
        tag: ascii_offset
        value: 64
      score_range:
        tag: score_range
        value: 0-62
      platforms:
        tag: platforms
        value: Illumina 1.3-1.7
  ILLUMINA_1_5:
    text: ILLUMINA_1_5
    description: Illumina 1.5+ (PHRED+64, special handling for 0-2)
    annotations:
      ascii_offset:
        tag: ascii_offset
        value: 64
      score_range:
        tag: score_range
        value: 3-62
      platforms:
        tag: platforms
        value: Illumina 1.5-1.7
  ILLUMINA_1_8:
    text: ILLUMINA_1_8
    description: Illumina 1.8+ (PHRED+33, modern standard)
    annotations:
      ascii_offset:
        tag: ascii_offset
        value: 33
      score_range:
        tag: score_range
        value: 0-41
      platforms:
        tag: platforms
        value: Illumina 1.8+, modern sequencers

    annotations:

        tag: H_bonding
        value: none
      examples:

        value: hexane, benzene, CCl4

    annotations:
      state:
        tag: state
        value: liquid salt
      examples:
        tag: examples
        value: imidazolium salts

LIQUID AFO:AFQ_0000113 A nearly incompressible fluid that conforms to the shape of its container GAS AFO:AFQ_0000114 A compressible fluid that expands to fill its container PLASMA AFO:AFQ_0000115 An ionized gas with freely moving charged particles BOSE_EINSTEIN_CONDENSATE None A state of matter formed at extremely low temperatures where particles occupy... FERMIONIC_CONDENSATE None A superfluid phase formed by fermionic particles at extremely low temperature... SUPERCRITICAL_FLUID None A state where distinct liquid and gas phases do not exist SUPERFLUID None A phase of matter with zero viscosity SUPERSOLID None A spatially ordered material with superfluid properties QUARK_GLUON_PLASMA None An extremely hot phase where quarks and gluons are not confined

name: StateOfMatterEnum
description: The physical state or phase of matter
from_schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets
rank: 1000
permissible_values:
  SOLID:
    text: SOLID
    description: A state of matter where particles are closely packed together with
      fixed positions
    meaning: AFO:AFQ_0000112
  LIQUID:
    text: LIQUID
    description: A nearly incompressible fluid that conforms to the shape of its container
    meaning: AFO:AFQ_0000113
  GAS:
    text: GAS
    description: A compressible fluid that expands to fill its container
    meaning: AFO:AFQ_0000114
  PLASMA:
    text: PLASMA
    description: An ionized gas with freely moving charged particles
    meaning: AFO:AFQ_0000115
  BOSE_EINSTEIN_CONDENSATE:
    text: BOSE_EINSTEIN_CONDENSATE
    description: A state of matter formed at extremely low temperatures where particles
      occupy the same quantum state
  FERMIONIC_CONDENSATE:
    text: FERMIONIC_CONDENSATE
    description: A superfluid phase formed by fermionic particles at extremely low
      temperatures
  SUPERCRITICAL_FLUID:
    text: SUPERCRITICAL_FLUID
    description: A state where distinct liquid and gas phases do not exist
  SUPERFLUID:
    text: SUPERFLUID
    description: A phase of matter with zero viscosity
  SUPERSOLID:
    text: SUPERSOLID
    description: A spatially ordered material with superfluid properties
  QUARK_GLUON_PLASMA:
    text: QUARK_GLUON_PLASMA
    description: An extremely hot phase where quarks and gluons are not confined

docs.title: Enum: SymptomSeverityEnum
docs.text: URI: valuesets:SymptomSeverityEnum

docs.title: Permissible Values
docs.text: Value Meaning Description ABSENT None MILD HP:0012825 MODERATE HP:0012826 SEVERE HP:0012828 LIFE_THREATENING None

docs.title: Slots
docs.text: Name Description symptom_severity The symptom severity classification

docs.title: Schema Source
docs.text: • from schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets

docs.title: LinkML Source
docs.text:
name: SymptomSeverityEnum
title: Severity levels for symptoms
from_schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets
rank: 1000
permissible_values:
  ABSENT:
    text: ABSENT
    annotations:
      grade:
        tag: grade
        value: '0'
    title: No symptoms
    aliases:
    - Blood group B
  MILD:
    text: MILD
    meaning: HP:0012825
    annotations:
      grade:
        tag: grade
        value: '1'
      impact:
        tag: impact
        value: minimal daily activity limitation
    title: Mild symptoms, minimal impact
  MODERATE:
    text: MODERATE
    meaning: HP:0012826
    annotations:
      grade:
        tag: grade
        value: '2'
      impact:
        tag: impact
        value: some daily activity limitation
    title: Moderate symptoms, some limitation
  SEVERE:
    text: SEVERE
    meaning: HP:0012828
    annotations:
      grade:
        tag: grade
        value: '3'
      impact:
        tag: impact
        value: significant daily activity limitation
    title: Severe symptoms, significant limitation
  LIFE_THREATENING:
    text: LIFE_THREATENING
    annotations:
      grade:
        tag: grade
        value: '4'
      impact:
        tag: impact
        value: urgent intervention required
    title: Life-threatening symptoms
    aliases:
    - Profound

URI: valuesets:TechnologyReadinessLevel

docs.title: Permissible Values
docs.text: Value Meaning Description TRL_1 None Basic principles observed and reported TRL_2 None Technology concept and/or application formulated TRL_3 None Analytical and experimental critical function and/or characteristic proof of ... TRL_4 None Component and/or breadboard validation in laboratory environment TRL_5 None Component and/or breadboard validation in relevant environment TRL_6 None System/subsystem model or prototype demonstration in a relevant environment TRL_7 None System prototype demonstration in an operational environment TRL_8 None Actual system completed and qualified through test and demonstration TRL_9 None Actual system proven through successful mission operations

docs.text: Name Description technology_readiness_level NASA's Technology Readiness Level scale for assessing the maturity of technol...

docs.text:
name: TechnologyReadinessLevel
conforms_to: ISO-16290:2013
description: NASA's Technology Readiness Level scale for assessing the maturity of
  technologies from basic research through operational deployment
title: Technology Readiness Level (TRL)
from_schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets
source: https://www.nasa.gov/directorates/heo/scan/engineering/technology/technology_readiness_level
rank: 1000
permissible_values:
  TRL_1:
    text: TRL_1
    description: Basic principles observed and reported
    title: TRL 1 - Basic Principles
  TRL_2:
    text: TRL_2
    description: Technology concept and/or application formulated
    title: TRL 2 - Technology Concept
  TRL_3:
    text: TRL_3
    description: Analytical and experimental critical function and/or characteristic
      proof of concept
    title: TRL 3 - Experimental Proof of Concept
  TRL_4:
    text: TRL_4
    description: Component and/or breadboard validation in laboratory environment
    title: TRL 4 - Lab Validation
  TRL_5:
    text: TRL_5
    description: Component and/or breadboard validation in relevant environment
    title: TRL 5 - Relevant Environment Validation
  TRL_6:
    text: TRL_6
    description: System/subsystem model or prototype demonstration in a relevant environment
    title: TRL 6 - Prototype Demonstration
  TRL_7:
    text: TRL_7
    description: System prototype demonstration in an operational environment
    title: TRL 7 - Operational Prototype
  TRL_8:
    text: TRL_8
    description: Actual system completed and qualified through test and demonstration
    title: TRL 8 - System Complete
  TRL_9:
    text: TRL_9
    description: Actual system proven through successful mission operations
    title: TRL 9 - Mission Proven

name: TemperatureUnitEnum
description: Units of temperature measurement
from_schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets
rank: 1000
permissible_values:
  KELVIN:
    text: KELVIN
    description: Kelvin (SI base unit)
    meaning: UO:0000012
    annotations:
      symbol:
        tag: symbol
        value: K
      system:
        tag: system
        value: SI
      absolute:
        tag: absolute
        value: 'true'
  CELSIUS:
    text: CELSIUS
    description: Celsius/Centigrade
    meaning: UO:0000027
    annotations:
      symbol:
        tag: symbol
        value: °C
      conversion:
        tag: conversion
        value: K - 273.15
    title: degree Celsius

    text: FAHRENHEIT
    description: Fahrenheit
    meaning: UO:0000195
    annotations:
      symbol:
        tag: symbol
        value: °F
      conversion:
        tag: conversion
        value: (K - 273.15) * 9/5 + 32
      system:
        tag: system
        value: imperial
    title: degree Fahrenheit
  RANKINE:
    text: RANKINE
    description: Rankine
    annotations:
      symbol:
        tag: symbol
        value: °R
      conversion:
        tag: conversion
        value: K * 9/5
      absolute:
        tag: absolute
        value: 'true'

name: VaccineTypeEnum
title: Types of vaccines
from_schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets
rank: 1000
permissible_values:
  LIVE_ATTENUATED:
    text: LIVE_ATTENUATED
    annotations:
      examples:
        tag: examples
        value: MMR, varicella, yellow fever
    title: Weakened live pathogen
  INACTIVATED:
    text: INACTIVATED
    annotations:
      examples:
        tag: examples
        value: flu shot, hepatitis A, rabies
    title: Killed pathogen
  SUBUNIT:
    text: SUBUNIT
    annotations:
      examples:
        tag: examples
        value: hepatitis B, HPV, pertussis
    title: Pathogen pieces
  TOXOID:
    text: TOXOID
    annotations:
      examples:
        tag: examples
        value: diphtheria, tetanus
    title: Inactivated toxin
  MRNA:
    text: MRNA
    annotations:
      examples:
        tag: examples
        value: COVID-19 (Pfizer, Moderna)
    title: mRNA vaccine
  VIRAL_VECTOR:
    text: VIRAL_VECTOR
    annotations:
      examples:
        tag: examples
        value: COVID-19 (J&J, AstraZeneca)
    title: Modified virus carrier

DSDNA_RT NCIT:C14349 Double-stranded DNA viruses that replicate through a single-stranded RNA inte... MIXED NCIT:C128790 Mixed or hybrid viral genome type UNCHARACTERIZED NCIT:C17998 Viral genome type not yet characterized

docs.text:
name: ViralGenomeTypeEnum
conforms_to: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltimore_classification
description: Types of viral genomes based on Baltimore classification
from_schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets
rank: 1000
permissible_values:
  DNA:
    text: DNA
    description: Viral genome composed of DNA
    meaning: CHEBI:16991
    title: deoxyribonucleic acid
  DSDNA:
    text: DSDNA
    description: Double-stranded DNA viral genome
    meaning: NCIT:C14348
    is_a: DNA
    title: Double Stranded DNA Virus
    aliases:
    - Baltimore Group I
    - Group I
  SSDNA:
    text: SSDNA
    description: Single-stranded DNA viral genome
    meaning: NCIT:C14350
    is_a: DNA
    title: Single Stranded DNA Virus
    aliases:
    - Baltimore Group II
    - Group II
  RNA:
    text: RNA
    description: Viral genome composed of RNA
    meaning: CHEBI:33697
    title: ribonucleic acid
  DSRNA:
    text: DSRNA
    description: Double-stranded RNA viral genome
    meaning: NCIT:C28518
    is_a: RNA
    title: Double Stranded RNA Virus
    aliases:
    - Baltimore Group III
    - Group III
  SSRNA:
    text: SSRNA
    description: Single-stranded RNA viral genome
    meaning: NCIT:C95939
    is_a: RNA
    title: Single-Stranded RNA
  SSRNA_POSITIVE:
    text: SSRNA_POSITIVE
    description: Positive-sense single-stranded RNA viral genome
    meaning: NCIT:C14351
    is_a: SSRNA
    title: Positive Sense ssRNA Virus
    aliases:
    - Baltimore Group IV
    - Group IV
    - (+)ssRNA
  SSRNA_NEGATIVE:
    text: SSRNA_NEGATIVE
    description: Negative-sense single-stranded RNA viral genome
    meaning: NCIT:C14346
    is_a: SSRNA
    title: Negative Sense ssRNA Virus
    aliases:
    - Baltimore Group V
    - Group V
    - (-)ssRNA
  SSRNA_RT:
    text: SSRNA_RT
    description: Single-stranded RNA viruses that replicate through a DNA intermediate
      (retroviruses)
    meaning: NCIT:C14347
    is_a: SSRNA
    title: Deltaretrovirus
    aliases:
    - Baltimore Group VI
    - Group VI
    - Retroviruses
  DSDNA_RT:
    text: DSDNA_RT
    description: Double-stranded DNA viruses that replicate through a single-stranded
      RNA intermediate (pararetroviruses)
    meaning: NCIT:C14349
    is_a: DSDNA
    title: Other Virus Grouping
    aliases:
    - Baltimore Group VII
    - Group VII
    - Pararetroviruses
  MIXED:
    text: MIXED
    description: Mixed or hybrid viral genome type
    meaning: NCIT:C128790
    title: Hybrid
  UNCHARACTERIZED:
    text: UNCHARACTERIZED
    description: Viral genome type not yet characterized
    meaning: NCIT:C17998
    title: Unknown

  OIL:

docs.title: Enum: WorkflowType
docs.text:
Types of computational processing workflows

URI: valuesets:WorkflowType

docs.title: Permissible Values
docs.text: Value Meaning Description MOTION_CORRECTION None Motion correction for cryo-EM movies CTF_ESTIMATION None Contrast transfer function estimation PARTICLE_PICKING None Particle picking from micrographs CLASSIFICATION_2D None 2D classification of particles CLASSIFICATION_3D None 3D classification of particles REFINEMENT_3D None 3D refinement of particle orientations MODEL_BUILDING None Atomic model building into density MODEL_REFINEMENT None Atomic model refinement PHASING None Phase determination for crystallography DATA_INTEGRATION None Integration of diffraction data DATA_SCALING None Scaling and merging of diffraction data SAXS_ANALYSIS None SAXS data analysis and modeling

docs.title: Slots
docs.text: Name Description workflow Types of computational processing workflows

docs.title: Schema Source
docs.text: • from schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets

docs.title: LinkML Source
docs.text:
name: WorkflowType
description: Types of computational processing workflows
from_schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets
rank: 1000
permissible_values:
  MOTION_CORRECTION:
    text: MOTION_CORRECTION
    description: Motion correction for cryo-EM movies
    annotations:
      software:
        tag: software
        value: MotionCorr, Unblur, RELION
  CTF_ESTIMATION:
    text: CTF_ESTIMATION
    description: Contrast transfer function estimation
    annotations:
      software:
        tag: software
        value: CTFFIND, Gctf, RELION
  PARTICLE_PICKING:
    text: PARTICLE_PICKING
    description: Particle picking from micrographs
    annotations:
      methods:
        tag: methods
        value: template matching, deep learning
      software:
        tag: software
        value: RELION, cryoSPARC, Topaz
  CLASSIFICATION_2D:
    text: CLASSIFICATION_2D
    description: 2D classification of particles
    annotations:
      purpose:
        tag: purpose
        value: sorting, cleaning particle dataset
  CLASSIFICATION_3D:
    text: CLASSIFICATION_3D
    description: 3D classification of particles
    annotations:
      purpose:
        tag: purpose
        value: conformational sorting, resolution improvement
  REFINEMENT_3D:
    text: REFINEMENT_3D
    description: 3D refinement of particle orientations
    annotations:
      algorithms:
        tag: algorithms
        value: expectation maximization, gradient descent
  MODEL_BUILDING:
    text: MODEL_BUILDING
    description: Atomic model building into density
    annotations:
      software:
        tag: software
        value: Coot, ChimeraX, Isolde
  MODEL_REFINEMENT:
    text: MODEL_REFINEMENT
    description: Atomic model refinement
    annotations:
      software:
        tag: software
        value: PHENIX, REFMAC, Buster
  PHASING:
    text: PHASING
    description: Phase determination for crystallography
    annotations:
      methods:
        tag: methods
        value: SAD, MAD, MR, MIR
  DATA_INTEGRATION:
    text: DATA_INTEGRATION
    description: Integration of diffraction data
    annotations:
      software:
        tag: software
        value: XDS, DIALS, HKL
  DATA_SCALING:
    text: DATA_SCALING
    description: Scaling and merging of diffraction data
    annotations:
      software:
        tag: software
        value: SCALA, AIMLESS, XSCALE
  SAXS_ANALYSIS:
    text: SAXS_ANALYSIS
    description: SAXS data analysis and modeling
    annotations:
      software:
        tag: software
        value: PRIMUS, CRYSOL, FoXS

Types of X-ray sources

URI: valuesets:XRaySource

docs.title: Permissible Values

docs.text:
name: XRaySource
description: Types of X-ray sources
from_schema: https://w3id.org/linkml/valuesets
rank: 1000
permissible_values:
  SYNCHROTRON:
    text: SYNCHROTRON
    description: Synchrotron radiation source
    annotations:
      advantages:
        tag: advantages
        value: high intensity, tunable wavelength
      brightness:
        tag: brightness
        value: 10^15-10^18 photons/s/mm²/mrad²
  ROTATING_ANODE:
    text: ROTATING_ANODE
    description: Rotating anode generator
    annotations:
      power:
        tag: power
        value: 3-18 kW typical
      target:
        tag: target
        value: copper, molybdenum common
  MICROFOCUS:
    text: MICROFOCUS
    description: Microfocus sealed tube
    annotations:
      spot_size:
        tag: spot_size
        value: 10-50 μm
      applications:
        tag: applications
        value: small crystals, in-house screening
  METAL_JET:
    text: METAL_JET
    description: Liquid metal jet source
    annotations:
      advantages:
        tag: advantages
        value: higher power density, longer lifetime
      metals:
        tag: metals
        value: gallium, indium
